definitions.definition: ( geology , obsolete ) Synonym of downthrow ( “ a depression of the strata on one side of a fault ; also, the degree of downward displacement in such a fault ” ) .

main_definition: ( geology , obsolete ) Synonym of downthrow ( “ a depression of the strata on one side of a fault ; also, the degree of downward displacement in such a fault ” ) .

definitions.definition: An act of looking downwards , usually as a sign of discouragement , sadness , etc., or sometimes modesty ; hence ( uncountable , archaic ) , dejection , melancholy .

subdefinitions.definition: An act, or the situation , of being cast or thrown to the ground .
A defeat , an overthrow ; also, an act of destruction or ruin .

definitions.definition: A cast ( “ change of expression of a data type ” ) from supertype to subtype .
A ventilating shaft down which air passes in circulating through a mine .

main_definition: ( countable ) An act of looking downwards , usually as a sign of discouragement , sadness , etc., or sometimes modesty ; hence ( uncountable , archaic ) , dejection , melancholy .
secondary_definitions: ( countable , computing ) A cast ( “ change of expression of a data type ” ) from supertype to subtype .
( countable , mining , chiefly attributive ) A ventilating shaft down which air passes in circulating through a mine .
